text: This list has all members of the Papua New Guinea cricket team who have played at least one T20I match. It is arranged in the order in which each player won his first Twenty20 cap. Where more than one player won his first Twenty20 cap in the same match, those players are listed alphabetically by surname. ==Background== Papua New Guinea were first given T20I status in January 2014. Then they got One Day International (ODI) status. This was a result of their performance at the 2014 World Cup Qualifier, where they placed fourth to narrowly miss out on qualifying for the 2015 World Cup."Netherlands, Kenya and Canada lose ODI status" – ESPNcricinfo. Retrieved 18 November 2015. The team made its ODI debut in November 2014, against Hong Kong,"The Barramundis' big break" – ESPNcricinfo. Retrieved 18 November 2015. but did not play a full Twenty20 International until July 2015, during the 2015 World Twenty20 Qualifier.International Twenty20 matches played by Papua New Guinea – CricketArchive. Retrieved 18 November 2015. Papua New Guinea's debut was originally planned in its second match of the tournament, against Hong Kong, but the match was rained out.Hong Kong v Papua New Guinea, ICC World Twenty20 Qualifier 2015 (Group A) – CricketArchive. Retrieved 18 November 2015. Instead, the team's first Twenty20 International came against Ireland, with PNG winning by two wickets.Ireland v Papua New Guinea, ICC World Twenty20 Qualifier 2015 (Group A) – CricketArchive. Retrieved 18 November 2015. In April 2018, the ICC decided to give full Twenty20 International (T20I) status to all its members. Therefore, all Twenty20 matches played between Papua New Guinea and other ICC members after 1 January 2019 will be a full T20I. ==Key== General * – Captain * – Wicket-keeper * First – Year of debut * Last – Year of latest game * Mat – Number of matches played Batting * Runs – Runs scored in career * HS – Highest score * Avg – Runs scored per dismissal * * – Batsman remained not out * 50 – Half-centuries scored * 100 – Centuries scored Bowling * Balls – Balls bowled in career * Wkt – Wickets taken in career * BBI – Best bowling in an innings * Ave – Average runs per wicket Fielding * Ca – Catches taken * St – Stumpings affected ==List of players== :Statistics are correct as of 4 April 2022.Players / Papua New Guinea / T20I caps – ESPNcricinfo. Retrieved 23 March 2019. title: List of Papua New Guinea Twenty20 International cricketers
